newtons_laws.name: Newton's Laws of Motion
newtons_laws.content:
Newton's Laws of Motion

First Law (Law of Inertia):

An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

Second Law (F = ma):

Force equals mass times acceleration (F = ma)

Third Law (Action-Reaction):

For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

Applications:
  • Car safety features (seatbelts, airbags)
  • Rocket propulsion
  • Walking (push backward, ground pushes forward)

kinematics.name: Kinematics
kinematics.content:
Kinematics Equations

Motion without considering forces.

Key Equations:
  • v = u + at
  • s = ut + ½at²
  • v² = u² + 2as

Where: u = initial velocity, v = final velocity, a = acceleration, t = time, s = displacement

work_energy.name: Work and Energy
work_energy.content:
Work-Energy Theorem

Work:

W = F × d × cos θ (Force × displacement × angle between them)

Kinetic Energy:

KE = ½mv²

Potential Energy:

PE = mgh (gravitational)

Conservation of Energy:

Total energy remains constant: KE₁ + PE₁ = KE₂ + PE₂

wave_properties.name: Wave Properties
wave_properties.content:
Wave Characteristics

Key Terms:
  • Wavelength (λ): Distance between crests
  • Frequency (f): Number of waves per second
  • Amplitude: Height of wave
  • Velocity: v = fλ
Types:
  • Transverse: Particles move perpendicular (light waves)
  • Longitudinal: Particles move parallel (sound waves)

sound.name: Sound Waves
sound.content:
Sound Physics

Properties:
  • Speed in air: ~343 m/s at 20°C
  • Loudness: Related to amplitude
  • Pitch: Related to frequency
Doppler Effect:

Change in frequency due to relative motion between source and observer.

reflection.name: Reflection
reflection.content:
Laws of Reflection

Angle of incidence = Angle of reflection

Types:
  • Specular: Smooth surfaces (mirrors)
  • Diffuse: Rough surfaces (paper)
Mirror Equation:

1/f = 1/u + 1/v where f = focal length, u = object distance, v = image distance

refraction.name: Refraction
refraction.content:
Snell's Law

n₁sin θ₁ = n₂sin θ₂

Key Concepts:
  • Refractive index: n = c/v (speed in vacuum/speed in medium)
  • Total internal reflection occurs when angle > critical angle
  • Applications: Lenses, prisms, fiber optics
